Yes, Korean cuisine is known for being quite spicy, and there are many dishes that reflect this. Here are a few Korean dishes that are particularly spicy:

1. Spicy Tofu Stew (Dubu Jjigae): A spicy stew made with tofu, vegetables, and sometimes meat or seafood. It is served hot and is a popular Korean comfort food.

2. Spicy Cold Noodles (Bibim Naengmyeon): A dish made with cold buckwheat noodles served in a spicy, sweet sauce made of gochujang (Korean red chili paste), vinegar, and sugar. It's a popular dish during hot summer months.

3. Spicy Chicken (Dak Galbi): A dish made with marinated chicken stir-fried with spicy sauce made of gochujang, soy sauce, honey, and sesame oil. It is often served with rice or noodles.

4. Spicy Rice Cake (Tteokbokki): A popular street food snack made with chewy rice cakes in a spicy sauce made of gochujang and other seasonings.

5. Spicy Fried Chicken (Korean Fried Chicken): Breaded chicken that is fried and coated in a spicy sauce. It is often served with pickled radishes and beer.

These dishes are all very spicy, so make sure you have water or other beverages nearby to cool down your palate!
